message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to make a mutually beneficial deal. My initial offer for the product is $1200000. I'm open to negotiations, but I'm looking for a price that reflects its true value.

I appreciate your initial offer, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I believe that's a more reasonable price considering the market value of similar products. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that you're looking to stay within your budget, but I have to consider the value that this product brings to the table. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. My counteroffer is $1100000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the product's worth while also being reasonable for you.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but $1100000 is still above my budget. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my limit. I'm thinking of $850000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and my budget constraints.

Bob, I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget, but I'm starting to get concerned that we're getting a bit too far apart. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. My counteroffer is $1050000. I believe this is a fair price that balances the product's value with your budget constraints.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still not comfortable with the price of $1050000. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I need to be closer to my budget. I'm thinking of $950000. I believe this is a fair price that balances the product's value with my financial constraints.

Bob, I understand that we're getting close to the end of our negotiation, but I still need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get to at least $1200000. My counteroffer is $1025000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the product's value and takes into account your budget constraints.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still not comfortable with the price of $1025000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to be closer to my budget. I'm thinking of $925000. I believe this is a fair price that balances the product's value with my financial constraints.

Bob, I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle. I'm willing to make one final concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. My counteroffer is $1075000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the product's value and takes into account your budget constraints. If this doesn't work, I'll have to consider other options.

Alice, I understand that you're trying to meet your minimum price, but I'm afraid I've reached my limit. I'm willing to make one final offer of $900000. If you're not willing to accept this price, I'll have to consider purchasing the product from John for $800000. I'm willing to walk away if we can't come to an agreement.
